physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features two women in the foreground. They are both wearing collared
 short sleeved tops. Both women are holding a booklet in their hands. Behind them in the background
 there are several other people standing. Some people are seated on top of a tree. There are no inscriptions seen on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.

sgcool_label_text:This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life
 including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.

metadata.title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of Corporal A. Silver and woman holding booklets
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features two women in the foreground. They are both wearing collared, short sleeved tops. Both women are holding a booklet in their hands. Behind them in the background, there are several other people standing. Some people are seated on top of a tree. There are no inscriptions seen on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
